intro: Adenocalymma velutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf sturtshrub, is a shrub native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has a woody stem with a distinctive, often branched structure. Adenocalymma velutinum is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
